intro: Bobua hayatae, commonly known as the Philippine bobua, is a rare flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas of montane forests, where it thrives in cool, humid conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat destruction, it is considered endangered. Conservation efforts are ongoing to protect this unique botanical species.
